docs.lead_paragraph: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Aug. 24 A spokesman for the Food and Drug Administration today found himself in the unusual position of tentatively agreeing with the poet Allen Ginsberg, a persistent advocate of legalizing LSD and marijuana.

headline.main: POET AND U.S. AIDE BACK DRUG STUDY; Ginsberg and F.D.A. Official Agree at Student Parley

docs.snippet: CHAMPAIGN, Ill., Aug. 24 A spokesman for the Food and Drug Administration today found himself in the unusual position of tentatively agreeing with the poet Allen Ginsberg, a persistent advocate of legalizing LSD and marijuana.

byline.original: By JONATHAN RANDAL Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration will propose today that the raw flesh of poultry and fish must not show the residue of two antibiotics used to preserve them. The action is intended to eliminate a possible public health hazard.

headline.main: F.D.A. SEEKS CURB ON DRUGS IN FOOD; Wants to Prohibit Residues of Antibiotics in Flesh

docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration will propose today that the raw flesh of poultry and fish must not show the residue of two antibiotics used to preserve them. The action is intended to eliminate a possible public health hazard.
